nameFr: chutney de coriandre à la noix de coco
descriptionEn: It can be used  to eat along with idli, dosa, vada, bonda or bajji
descriptionFr: Il peut être utilisé pour manger avec idli, dosa vada, bonda ou bajji
method: 1. Clean the bunch of coriander leaves thoroughly. 2. grind 1 cup of coconut chunks to powder in a mixie 3. Then add 3/4th cup of roasted gram, 3 red chilli, 1 inch ginger and grind it 4. Then add coriander leaves, salt to taste and 1/2 cup of water and grind it to a paste. 5. Serve it is a thottukai for idli, dosa, vada, bonda or bajji
tips: Defreeze the coconut chunks before 30 minutes to obtain soft texture. You can grind the coconut chunks to a poweder and store it in an airtight container.

method:
1. Wash and dry the cucumber. The skin can be left on or partially removed. If using field cucumbers, peel and remove seeds prior to slicing.
2. Slice the cucumbers as thinly as possible (almost see through). Set aside
3. Place the vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper in a mixing bowl and whisk until the sugar has dissolved completely
4. Add the cucumber, onion and dill. Mix together well
5. Refrigerate, turning occasionally, for at least 1 hour
tips: Defreeze the coconut chunks before 30 minutes to obtain soft texture. You can grind the coconut chunks to a poweder and store it in an airtight container.

method:
1. Heat a frying pan or skillet over medium heat. Add the diced bacon and fry until just beginning to crisp. Add the peppers, onion and jalapeno if using and fry, stirring occasionally, until the bacon is cooked and the vegetables are softened. Remove bacon and vegetables from the pan and set aside. Pour off the fat from the pan and discard. Wipe out the pan with a paper towel.

2. In a bowl, whisk the egg, milk salt and pepper together. Add 1 Tbsp. / 15 ml of oil to the pan and heat over medium to low heat. Add the egg mixture and stirring, cook the eggs until just set.

3. While the eggs are cooking, lay out the tortilla shells on a flat surface. Divide the egg mixture between the 6 shells. Sprinkle each with 1 Tbsp. / 15 ml of grated cheese. Roll shells tightly, folding in the edges. Serve immediately with salsa on the side.
tips: If for school lunch, wrap in parchment paper and refrigerate for reheating in a microwave. Or, if for a later daily meal, wrap in foil and reheat in a 325-f oven for 8 – 10 minutes.

method:
Preheat oven to 325 f 

1. Bring 3 litres of water, with 1 Tsp. (5 ml) of salt to the boil. Add the macaroni noodles and cook following package directions. Stir occasionally during cooking. Drain and rinse well under cold water. Place in a colander and set aside.

2. For the sauce - In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the flour and mix well. Lower heat and cook for about 5 minutes. Stir frequently.

3. Heat the milk in a separate pan until warm and slowly add to the butter/flour mixture (the roux) over low heat, stirring frequently, cook until sauce thickens slightly, about 10-15 minutes.  

4. Turn the heat to very low, cover the saucepan and let sit for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, to cook out the taste of the flour. Add the grated cheese, salt and pepper. Stir until the cheese has melted. 

5. Add the noodles to the sauce and mix well. Place in a greased 8” x 8” deep baking dish. If the sauce appears too thick, add some warmed milk until desired consistency is reached. Remember, sauce will thicken during cooking as the pasta will absorb the sauce. 

6. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the macaroni and dot with butter or margarine. For a spicier topping sprinkle with the chili powder. Bake uncovered in pre-heated oven for about 30-35 minutes or until the sauce has bubbled around the edges and the top is nicely browned. Allow to sit for a few minutes before serving.

nameFr: Recette de fromage grillé à lavocat
descriptionEn: The avocado sandwich is very simple yet healthy recipe
descriptionFr: Le sandwich à lavocat est une recette très simple mais saine
method: 1. Cut the avocado, remove the seed, scoop the pulp and chop it roughly.    2. In a food processor add avocados, coriander leaves, green chili, lime juice, and salt, and blend smoothly.    3. Take bread slices, place the sliced cheese, and spread the avocado mixture.    4. Cover it with another sliced cheese and bread. Heat a pan and grease it with butter.    5. Place the sandwich on the pan and cook it on low to medium flame.    6. Once it becomes golden brown, flip and repeat the same.    7. Remove it from the pan, cut it gently and serve hot.
tips: Using rustic bread slices will make the sandwich crispier even after it cools down.

descriptionEn: The banana bread can be made with simple ingredients available at home
descriptionFr: Le pain aux bananes peut être fait avec des ingrédients simples disponibles à la maison
method: 1. Preheat oven to 350F. In a bowl add ripened or mashed bananas, a stick of butter, honey, brown sugar, vanilla, eggs, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon powder, and salt.      2. Mix all the ingredients together until its all combined. Add the flour and oats and mix them together.      3. Add 3/4 cup of the chopped walnuts and fold in with a spatula or wooden spoon. Do not overheat the batter.      4. Pour the batter into a loaf tin and sprinkle the leftover nuts and oats over the top.      5. Bake at 350F for 45-55 minutes. Use a toothpick to check whether the bread is cooked or not.      6. Take the bread from the oven and bring it to room temperature and slice it and enjoy.
tips: Use the broiler option in the oven for 2-3 minutes to get a nice golden brown on the outside.

descriptionEn: The sauce can be eaten along with bread, roti or chips.
descriptionFr: La sauce peut être consommée avec du pain, du roti ou des frites
method: 1. Finely chop the parsley, mint, cilantro, shallots, and garlic.      2. Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl with olive oil and red wine vinegar.      3. Let the sauce sit out for at least 15 - 20 minutes at room temperature to let all the flavors meld.
tips: Prepare the sauce and store the leftovers in the refrigerator.

descriptionEn: The salad is rich in nutrients and contains antioxidants
descriptionFr: La salade est riche en nutriments et contient des antioxydants
method: 1.  Smash the cucumber using the rolling pin or you can use the flat side of a clever if you have one.    2. Chop the cucumber into bite-size pieces.      3. Place the chopped cucumber in a strainer/colander over a bowl and sprinkle with salt and sugar.    4. Mix and allow the cucumber to drain for at least 15-30 mins in the fridge or until almost ready to serve.    5. For the dressing: Add the Rice Vinegar, Sesame Oil, Light Soy & remaining sugar. Grate in two garlic cloves and whisk it all together.    6. Add the drained cucumber to the dressing and mix well to coat all the pieces.    7. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper, lightly toasted sesame seeds and chopped fresh cilantro.    8. Mix, plate & garnish with more cilantro & sesame seeds.
tips: Loosely wrap the cucumber first in cling wrap so you dont get little cucumber bits and juices flying everywhere.

descriptionEn: This soup has masoor dal and coconut milk along with vegetables and spices.
descriptionFr: Cette soupe contient du masoor dal et du lait de coco, ainsi que des légumes et des épices.
method: 1. Heat butter and add Indian bay leaves, crushed coriander, garlic, ginger, onion, and potato.     2. Instant pot mode : Saute. Cancel saute and add all spice powders.      3. After that add masoor dal and coriander leaves. Give it a mix. Add 1 & ½ cups of water.      4. Close the lid and pressure cook for 5 minutes at high pressure.      5. Add 1 & ½ cup water furthermore to dilute plus the required salt. Blend smoothly using an immersion blender.      6. Once done, again give it a boil and add coconut milk. Mix well.      7. Turn off the heat. Adjust salt. Add lemon juice and mix well. Serve hot.
tips: You can prepare this soup on the stove top too. Either use a pressure cooker the same way or the OG way of simmering in a soup pot.

descriptionEn: An easy and simple instant breakfast or snack meal with healthy rolled oats.
descriptionFr: Un petit-déjeuner ou une collation instantané facile et simple avec des flocons davoine sains.
method: 1. In a mixie, take 1 cup of oats and finely powder it, transfer the oats to a large bowl.      2. Add ¼ cup besan, 1 tsp cumin and 1 / 4th tsp turmeric, ½ tomato, ½ carrot, ½ onion, ½ capsicum, ¼ cup curd and ½ tsp salt, and ½ cup water. Mix well.      3. Rest the batter for 5 minutes, or until the oats and rava are soaked well.      4. Now add water as required and form a smooth batter.      5. Just before making an omelette, add ½ tsp eno fruit salt and mix gently.      6. Immediately, heat 2 tsp oil in a pan and pour the prepared batter, cover and cook for 2 minutes.      7. Once the base is cooked well, flip over and cook both sides.      8. Slit in the centre and add oil, for roasting ½ tsp butter, few coriander for extra flavour.Serve hot.
tips: You can also use some flavored oats instead of the rolled oats.

descriptionEn: A sweet and tangy onion condiment thats perfect on sandwiches, tacos, burgers, nachos, salads, or anything that needs some extra zing!
descriptionFr: Un condiment à loignon sucré et acidulé qui est parfait sur les sandwichs, les tacos, les hamburgers, les nachos, les salades ou tout ce qui a besoin dun peu plus de piquant!
method: 1. Peel and thinly slice the red onion, and add white wine vinegar, water, sugar, salt, garlic, allspice, black peppercorns & bay leaves to a saucepan.      2. Bring to a boil on medium-high heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar.      3. When the pickling liquid comes to a boil switch off and pour the hot liquid over the sliced onions in a heat-proof bowl/dish.      4. Add the lime juice and make sure all the onions are submerged in the liquid. Allow it to cool on the counter.      5. You will notice the onions turning a bright vibrant pinkish color within a few minutes. You can eat them within an hour or two.
tips: Pickled onions taste even better after soaking them overnight.

descriptionEn: A spicy flavourful recipe to satisfy your hunger pangs.
descriptionFr: Une recette épicée et savoureuse pour satisfaire vos fringales.
method: 1. Cook pasta and chickpeas. Heat a pan with oil, and temper with cumin seeds. Add garlic, finely chopped onion, green chilies, and fry till transparent.      2. Add pasta sauce/tomato puree. Fry for a minute. Add red chili and chana masala powders, required salt, and kasoori methi, crushed well.      3. Fry for 2 mins. Add cooked chana, 2 tablespoons of the reserved chana cooked water, or according to your consistency preference.      4. Let it cook for 2 minutes. Add cooked pasta and mix well.      5. Add more oil if needed. Toss well until the sauce coats the pasta shiningly, and garnish with coriander leaves.
tips: For soft chana add some baking soda while cooking in a pressure cooker.

descriptionEn: A simple healthy and tasty rasam recipe that is ideally served with hot steamed rice.
descriptionFr: Une recette de rasam simple, saine et savoureuse qui est idéalement servie avec du riz chaud à la vapeur.
method: 1. In a large vessel add tomatoes, ginger, chili, coriander, turmeric, curry leaves, and water.      2. Boil for 10 minutes or till tomatoes turn soft and mushy.      3. Add pressure cooked toor dal, and add salt to taste. Mix well.      4. Boil for 3 minutes, do not over boil after adding dal.      5. Prepare the tempering by heating up the ghee. Add mustard seeds, cumin, red chili, curry leaves, asafoetida, and pepper.      6. Once the tempering splutters, pour the tempering onto the prepared rasam. Serve hot with rice.
tips: The juice of lemon should be always thin and watery.

nameFr: Croustilles de pomme de terre masala
descriptionEn: Potato masala chips is an instant snack prepared with potato, gram flour, rice flour, chilli powder and sesame seeds.
descriptionFr: Les chips de pomme de terre masala sont une collation instantanée préparée avec de la pomme de terre, de la farine de gramme, de la farine de riz, de la poudre de piment et des graines de sésame.
method: 1. Peel the skin of the potato and keep immersed in water. Use a grater with large holes and grate the potatoes.     2. Grate the potatoes by starting from one end and finishing at another end so that you get a longer grated potato, otherwise will fall short.     3. Keep the grated potato immersed in water and wash well. Drain completely without water in the potato.     4. Take grated potato in a mixing bowl. Add gram flour, rice flour, sesame seeds, red chili powder, turmeric, asafoetida, salt. Deep fry in oil and serve hot.
tips: The juice of lemon should be always thin and watery.

nameFr: Sandwich à la salade de poulet
method:
Heat oven to 325f
                1.	Rub the oil over the chicken thighs and sprinkle with a little salt and pepper.
                2.	Place the chicken thighs on a baking sheet and bake until the chicken is thoroughly cooked (approx. 30 minutes. Check for “doneness” by cutting chicken or using a digital thermometer*)
                3.	When cooked, cool slightly, cover and place in refrigerator for use.
                4.	When cooled, chop the chicken into small dice and place in bowl. Add mayonnaise and salt and pepper and mix together well.
                5.	Lay out four (4) slices of bread on a cutting board or counter top and divide and spread the filling between two (2) slices of bread. Top each with the remaining slices. Cut diagonally, wrap well and refrigerate for use.
tips:
1. Try adding 2 Tbsp. (30 ml) of finely chopped celery, green onion and / or onion to the chicken mixture.
                2. The number of sandwiches made will depend on the amount of filling placed on the bread.
                3. 6 ozs W of chicken will shrink to approximately 4 ozs W after baking.
                4. *If you have a digital thermometer, the chicken is cooked when the internal temperature reads 165 f.

method:
1. Place the eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and continue cooking for approximately 10 minutes.
                2. Remove from the heat and run cold water over the eggs until fully cooled.(eggs can be cooked the day before use, cooled and placed in the refrigerator)
                3. Shell the eggs and into a bowl, grate the eggs using a grater, or, mash using a fork.
                4. Add the mayonnaise, salt and pepper and mix gently together.
                5. Lay out six (6) pieces of bread on a cutting board or counter top and divide and spread the filling between three (3) slices of bread. Top each with the remaining slices. Cut diagonally, wrap well and refrigerate for use.
tips:
1. Try adding 1 ½ Tbsp. (22.5 ml) of finely chopped celery, green onion or onion to the egg mixture.
                2. The number of sandwiches made will depend on the amount of filling placed on the bread.

method:
1. Place the beans in a large bowl and cover with cold water. Soak overnight. Add more water as necessary to ensure that the beans stay covered. In the morning drain and rinse the beans.
                2. Preheat the oven to 250f / 120c and place the oven rack in the middle position.
                3. Combine all of the ingredients except the salt, in a large ovenproof Dutch oven or a large ovenproof saucepan that has a tight fitting cover. Add pepper to taste. Add enough water to cover the beans by 2” / 5cm and bring to a boil.
                4. Remove from the stove. Cover the Dutch oven and place in oven.
                5. Bake for about 7 hours, stirring every hour until the beans are tender. Adding more water as needed during cooking.
                6. Just prior to beans being ready, remove about ½ cup of beans, mash and return to pot.
tips: Do not add the salt until the beans are almost done as this tends to toughen beans.

method:
Preheat oven to 350f
                1. Wash and scrub the potatoes. Leave wet. Sprinkle with salt. Cut a slit in the top of the potato and place on a parchment lined baking sheet.
                2. Bake at 350f for about an hour until a toothpick inserted in the potato offers no resistance. The potato skin should be dry and slightly crisp.
                3. When cooked, press the ends of the potato together to open the slit and expose the potato.
tips:
1. Use a potato such as Russet, which will produce a loose, mealy texture when baked. New potatoes will not produce this light, mealy texture.
                2. Through a process called “osmosis” the salt on the skin will be drawn into the potato. No additional salt should be needed.
                3. To make this potato more of a meal, top with one or more of the following: butter, small steamed broccoli florets, cheese sauce, grated cheese, bacon bits, sour cream or chopped green onions

method:
1. In a large bowl, add the flour and season with salt and pepper. Add the water, buttermilk and a “splash” of soda water.
                2. Mix all ingredients until smooth. The batter will be quite thin.
                3. Heat enough oil, about 6 cups / 1 ½ litres in a medium heavy saucepan or deep fryer until the *temperature reaches 325 – 350f.
                4. Place the all purpose flour in a bowl and coat the fish pieces. Dip the fish into the batter and gently lower into the hot oil and fry, turning, for about 8 – 10 minutes until golden brown. Reduce the time if the fish fillets are thin.
                5. Serve the fish with Tartare sauce.
tips:
1. *A digital thermometer is essential if using a saucepan to heat the oil, in order to check the temperature of the oil and to make sure that it does not overheat and become a fire risk. Be sure to remove the oil from the stove as soon as you have finished cooking the fish. The oil, when cooled, can be strained through cheesecloth, placed in a covered container, refrigerated and kept until the next time you deep fry.
                2. Buttermilk: No need to buy. Just mix 1 cup of milk with 1 Tbsp of white vinegar, mix, let stand for 5 minutes and use in recipe(s)
                3. Self Rising flour: To make your own, just mix 1 ¼  cups of all purpose flour with 1 ¾  Tsp. of baking powder and ½ Tsp. of salt.

method:
1. Place the flour in a bowl and add the beef. Mix well to coat the beef. Remove the beef from the flour shaking to remove any excess flour.
                2. Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed oven proof pan or Dutch oven over medium high heat and, in batches, brown the beef cubes on all sides. As they brown transfer them to a bowl.
                3. Into the same pot that you browned the beef in, add the carrots, onion, celery and vinegar. Fry vegetables until softened. Scrape any burnt “bits” from the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon. Add the garlic, if using and fry for a further minute.
                4. Add the tomato paste and stir well for about 1 minute. Add the beef and any juices that have accumulated in the bowl. Add the heated beef broth, the water, bay leaf and thyme. Season with salt and pepper. While stirring, bring to a boil. Cover the pan and place in a 325-f oven for about 2 hours.
                5. Remove the pot from the oven and add the potatoes. Stir to mix. Cover and place pot back in the oven for about 1 hour or until the vegetables, meat and potatoes are tender and the sauce has thickened. Taste and adjust the seasonings if necessary.
tips: This stew freezes well in an airtight container. Remove the potatoes prior to freezing as they don’t freeze well.

descriptionEn: Macaroni, Beef and Tomato casserole
descriptionFr: Casserole de macaronis, bœuf et tomates
method:
1. Cook the macaroni noodles “al dente” (see below) in boiling water following package directions. Drain and rinse well under cold running water. Set aside in colander.
                2. In a large skillet or frying pan cook the beef until browned and no trace of pink remains. Drain the fat from the pan and discard.
                3. Add the diced onions and peppers and lightly fry for a few minutes. Add the garlic if using, tomato paste and stir to mix. Add the diced tomatoes and their juice, the vinegar, basil and oregano, salt and pepper and macaroni. Mix together well. Taste for seasoning and add extra salt and pepper if necessary. Cook over medium low heat, stirring occasionally for about 30 – 40 minutes until all flavours have blended. Or, place in greased baking dish, sprinkle lightly with grated cheese and bake in 325 f oven until heated through and cheese is lightly browned.
tips: Al Dente or “to the tooth”, means the ideal consistency of cooked pasta. During cooking the macaroni will absorb some of the liquid. If you need to, add a little beef broth or water.

nameFr: Pudding au pain et au beurre
method:
Preheat oven to 350f
                1.	Butter the bread, remove crusts and cut into two triangles.
                2.	Arrange half of the bread, buttered side up, in a greased 13” x 9” deep baking dish. Sprinkle with half of the raisin / sultana mix. Sprinkle with the sugar and cover with the remaining bread. Sprinkle with remaining raisin / sultana mix.
                3.	In a bowl, combine the eggs, milk, nutmeg and cinnamon and mix well. Pour over the bread.
                4.	Bake at 350f for about 35 – 40 minutes until the bread is lightly browned and the custard has set.
                5.	While the pudding is cooking, place the jam or marmalade in a small saucepan add a Tbsp. / 15ml of water and, over low heat, while stirring, melt the jam or marmalade. Remove the pudding from the oven and spread the warm jam or marmalade over the pudding. Serve warm.
tips: Serve with whipped cream or a lemon sauce.

method:
1. Lightly toast the English muffin.
                2. Cook bacon until crisp. Set aside. Drain fat from pan.
                3. In the same pan place a very little butter or margarine and heat over medium heat. When heated, break the egg into the pan and break the yolk.  Sprinkle the egg very lightly with salt and pepper. Cover the frying pan with a lid allowing the yolk to firm up while the egg white cooks. When the yolk is almost firm and the white is cooked, flip the egg over. Continue cooking until the egg yolk has set.
                4. Place the cheese slice on the heated muffin bottom. Top with the egg and bacon.  Add the top half of the muffin.
tips:
1. If making a breakfast sandwich with a sausage patty, fry the patty in a frying pan in a little oil. When cooked through, remove from pan and keep warm. Wipe out the pan with a cloth or paper towel before adding the egg.
                2. If preferred, a slice of ham can be substituted for the bacon or sausage.

method:
1. Heat the oil in a frying pan or skillet over medium heat. Season the chicken breasts or thighs with salt and pepper and fry gently until no longer pink (165 f). Remove from heat and keep warm.
                2. In the same pan, fry the onions and peppers until tender crisp. Add the taco mix and a little water and mix well. Simmer until flavours have blended, liquid has reduced and onion and peppers still retain some firmness. Taste for seasoning and adjust if necessary.
                3. Slice the chicken into thin slices.
                4. Warm the tortilla shells in a warm (225 f) oven for a minute or so and place on a flat working surface.
                5. Divide the sliced chicken and onion, pepper mix amongst the tortilla shells. Top each tortilla with the grated cheese and top each with a Tbsp. of sour cream and salsa.
                6. Fold shells over mixture, or roll.
tips: Serve with Mexi rice and seasoned corn kernels for a full meal

method:
To cook the fish, either 1. Gently fry in a butter and oil mix, or, 2. The better method is to poach the fish in simmering water with the addition of onion pieces, celery pieces, some lemon peel or juice and salt and pepper. Remove fish when “just done”. This should just take a few minutes. Remove from liquid, cool and flake.
                1. Place mashed potatoes, flaked fish, onions, beaten eggs, parsley, mustard powder, sour cream and salt and pepper in a large bowl and mix together until thoroughly mixed.
                2. Form the mixture into about 16 equal patties and roll in the breadcrumbs. Cover the patties and place in the refrigerator to “firm up” for an hour, or longer
                3. Heat the oil in a non-stick pan and fry the patties on each side for about 3 – 4 minutes until lightly browned. Serve immediately, accompanied with tartare sauce.
tips: The fish and potatoes can be prepared ahead of time, refrigerated and finished when ready to cook.

nameFr: Purée de pommes de terre à lail
method:
1. Place the potato chunks in cold water or under cold running water for about 20 minutes to remove some of the starch. Drain.
                2. Place the potatoes and garlic in cold water in a saucepan, add a little salt. Bring to the boil. Lower heat and simmer until potatoes are tender.
                3. Drain the potatoes and using a potato masher or “ricer” (see below) mash the potatoes. Add butter, cream or milk and white pepper to taste. Do not over mash the potatoes as this will toughen them. This is where the ricer is the best choice as the potatoes are only put through once and it eliminates any lumps of potato.

1. In a large saucepan, brown the beef (break up any lumps) along with the onion and garlic. Drain off excess fat and discard.
                2. Add potatoes, beef broth, tomatoes, tomato soup, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, Italian spice and bay leaf. Bring to boil. Lower heat and simmer covered for about 10 – 15 minutes.
                3. Add the vegetables and continue simmering for about 15 – 20 minutes until the vegetables and potatoes are tender. Remove the bay leaf. Check seasoning and consistency, adjust as necessary. Add more broth or water if required.

nameFr: Longe de porc rôtie aux herbesr
method:
1. Rub the vegetable oil all over the pork.
                2. Mix all of the spices together and rub all over the pork loin.
                3. Place the pork in a roasting pan or baking sheet. Cover with foil loosely to prevent the spices burning and place in a 325-f oven and bake until the internal temperature reaches 160 f to 165 f (for food safety, the use of a digital thermometer is key to ensuring that protein items are cooked to the correct temperature). Remove the foil for the last 15 to 20 minutes of cooking time.
                4. Remove from oven and let rest for about 15 minutes before slicing.
tips: Slice the pork thinly as thin slices taste better that thick slices. Serve with apple sauce.

method:
Preheat oven to 350f / 175c
                1.	Cook the noodles following package direction less 1-2 minutes, as the noodles will continue cooking in the sauce. Drain and rinse well under cold water.
                2.	For the sauce - In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the flour and mix well. Lower heat and cook for about 5 minutes. Stir frequently.
                3.	Heat the milk in a separate pan until warm and slowly add to the butter/flour mixture (the roux) over low heat, stirring frequently, cook until sauce thickens slightly, about 10-15 minutes.
                4.	Remove from heat and add the cheese, salt and pepper. Stir until the cheese has melted. Place back on low heat if cheese does not fully melt.
                5.	Add the noodles to the sauce and mix well.Place in a greased 8" x 8" baking dish. If the sauce appears too thick, add some warmed milk until desired consistency is reached. Remember, sauce will thicken during cooking as the pasta will absorb the liquid.
                6.	Sprinkle the grated cheese, breadcrumbs and chili powder (optional) over the top and bake uncovered in pre-heated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until the sauce has bubbled around the edges and the top is nicely browned. Allow to sit for a few minutes before serving.

Preheat the oven to 325f
                1. In a large bowl place the beef, bread crumbs, onion, milk, egg, BBQ sauce, Worcestershire sauce, parsley, salt, garlic powder and pepper. Using your hands, mix together until well combined.
                2. Add the meat mixture to a 9” x 5” loaf pan and lightly press down to level.
                3. In a small bowl add the ketchup, brown sugar and vinegar and stir to combine. Spread this sauce over the meatloaf evenly.
                4. Bake in a preheated oven for about 1 hour. Remove from the oven, Let the meatloaf rest for 10 minutes before removing from pan and slicing.
tips: For a complete meal, add mashed potatoes and a vegetable of your choice for a complete comforting meal.

descriptionEn: A simple and tasty salad, suitable to accompany almost any meal.
descriptionFr: Une salade simple et savoureuse, adaptée pour accompagner presque tous les repas.
method:
1.	Combine the sugar, vinegar, oil and salt and pepper in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat, whisking occasionally until the sugar is dissolved. Cool slightly.
                2. Combine the remaining ingredients in a glass bowl. Add the dressing and toss to coat.
                3. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Toss and serve using a slotted spoon. Serve over a crisp lettuce leaf.
tips: *Finely diced tomato can be substituted for the red pepper.

nameEn: Oven baked Pork Chops with an onion, mushroom sauce
nameFr: Côtelettes de porc cuites au four avec un oignon, sauce aux champignons
method:
Pre-heat oven to 350f / 180c
                1.	Heat the oil over medium high heat in an oven safe, heavy bottomed skillet.
                2.	Sprinkle the pork chops with a little pepper and fry 2-3 minutes on each side until browned.
                3.	Sprinkle the chops with the onion soup mix and add the water to the skillet. Stir to mix.
                4.	Place the skillet in the pre-heated oven and bake for about 15- 20 minutes. After about 15 minutes add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet, mix and continue to bake for another 15 – 20 minutes until the pork chops are tender Remove the pork chops to a plate, reserving the drippings and mushrooms in the skillet.
                5.	To make the gravy - In a separate saucepan melt the butter or margarine over low heat. Stir in the flour and mix well together to make a roux. Cook until the roux is a light golden colour, stirring constantly. Continue to cook for a few minutes until the flour taste has been “cooked out”.
                6.	Spoon the roux into the skillet, turn heat to medium low and mix well with the drippings and mushrooms in the skillet. Add hot water if the sauce is too thick. Add the pork chops to the skillet and spoon over the gravy. Continue to cook for a few minutes until flavours have blended and chops and gravy have heated through. Taste for seasoning and adjust if necessary. Serve sprinkled with chopped parsley.
tips: Boneless chops may be used but do not generally have the flavour of bone in chops. Pork shoulder chops can be substituted for loin chops.

method:
1.	Heat the stock in saucepan. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan that has a well-fitting lid, add the oil and heat over medium heat. Add the onions, carrots and celery. Cook, stirring occasionally until the vegetables are just tender. Add the rice and, stirring, coat the rice with the oil.
                2. Add salt and pepper. Be careful not to add too much salt. Taste the broth and if salty, reduce the amount of added salt as the rice will absorb the salt.
                3. Add the hot broth to the rice. Most long grain rice requires 2 cups of liquid to every cup of rice. Stir while adding the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to very low, cover the saucepan and cook following rice package directions. Usually 15 – 25 minutes. Do not uncover the saucepan while the rice is cooking.
                4. After cooking for the appropriate time, remove from the heat and set aside, covered, for 10 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork and stir in the chopped parsley.
tips:
1. Try adding cooked green peas to the rice for an interesting variation
                2. Just Tender – The vegetables maintain a little firmness.

method:
1. Peel potatoes and wash well in cold water to remove some of the starch. Drain.
                2. Place the potatoes into a large saucepan, cover with cold water and add 1 Tsp. of salt. Bring to the boil, turn heat to medium and simmer until a small knife inserted into the potato meets a little resistance. Remove from the heat and cool slightly.
                3. Place the canola oil, the rosemary and ½ Tsp of salt and ¼ Tsp of pepper into a bowl. Add the potatoes and mix gently to coat the potatoes.
                4. Place the potatoes onto a baking sheet or into an ovenproof glass baking dish. Pour any remaining oil in the bowl over the potatoes and place in a 325-f oven and roast turning once, until a knife inserted into the potato meets no resistance and the potatoes are lightly browned and are crispy on the outside.

nameEn: Sweet And Spicy Glazed Chicken Thighs
nameFr: Cuisses De Poulet Glacées Sucrées Et Épicées
method:
1. In a small bowl combine the brown sugar, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper. Mix together.
                2. Using paper towels, pat dry the chicken thighs and liberally sprinkle the spice mixture over the chicken, coating both sides.
                3. Add the oil to a large skillet, frying pan or saucepan. Turn heat to medium low. When the oil is hot, add the chicken pieces and cook for approximately 5 – 7 minutes on each side until the chicken is cooked through and the sugar has turned into a deep brown glaze.
                Serve hot over rice or noodles. Add a vegetable of your choice for a complete meal.
tips:
1. Remove the skin from the chicken prior to cooking.
                2. Be careful not to cook the chicken at too high a heat as this will burn the sugar.
                3. During cooking, move and turn the chicken pieces with a spatula to prevent sticking.

method:
1. Place the oil in a heavy bottomed saucepan. Heat the oil over medium heat. When hot add the onion and fry until softened (do not brown)
                2. Add the ground beef and cook until cooked through and no pink remains. Drain and discard fat from the saucepan.
                3. Add the garlic, chili powder, cumin, coriander and the salt and pepper. Cook together for a few minutes.
                4. Add the tomato sauce and jalapenos. Lower heat and simmer until thickened. Taste for seasoning and adjust if necessary.
                5. Heat taco shells in oven until warm and crisp. Place 1 – 2 Tbsp. of meat mixture into shell and top with your favourite toppings - Shredded lettuce, diced tomato, onion, salsa, jalapenos and sour cream.

descriptionEn: A classic accompaniment for battered fish
descriptionFr: Un accompagnement classique pour le poisson pané
method: Place all of the ingredients in a bowl and mix together until thoroughly mixed. Cover and store in refrigerator for use.

descriptionEn: A classic accompaniment for battered fish
descriptionFr: Un accompagnement classique pour le poisson pané
method: Place all ingredients in a bowl and mix together until thoroughly mixed. Cover and store in refrigerator for use.
tips: Add 1 Tbsp. / 15ml of capers, mashed with a fork.

method:
Preheat oven to 325f
                1.	Cook noodles al dente, according to package directions. Drain, refresh (rinse well) and drain. Set aside covered in the refrigerator.
                2.	Melt the butter or margarine in a large saucepan. Add the onions and over medium heat, cook to soften (do not brown). Add the sliced mushrooms and cook for 3 – 4 minutes more.
                3.	Whisk together the milk and flour in a bowl, mixing well to remove any lumps. Slowly add to the mushroom, onion mixture, stirring well after each addition. Bring to a simmer and stir constantly until thickened. Cover with some greased parchment paper (to prevent skin forming). Lower the heat to very low and allow to sit for about 25 minutes, stirring occasionally, to cook out the taste of the flour.
                4.	Remove cover. Add some extra warm milk if sauce is too thick as the noodles will absorb some of the liquid and thicken the sauce while cooking. Stir and add the diced peppers, green peas, the thyme and salt and pepper to taste.
                5.	Add the noodles and stir gently to combine with the sauce. Place in a greased ovenproof baking dish, dot with butter or margarine and bake until heated through, lightly browned and bubbly.

nameFr: Sandwich à la salade de thon
method:
1. Open the can of tuna and drain the liquid. Place tuna into a bowl.
                2. Break up the tuna using a fork. Add the mayonnaise and the salt and pepper and mix gently together.
                3. Lay out six (6) pieces of bread on a cutting board or counter top and divide and spread the filling between three (3) slices of bread. Top each with the remaining slices. Cut diagonally, wrap well and refrigerate for use.
tips:
1. Try adding 1 ½ Tbsp. (22.5 ml) of finely chopped celery, green onion or onion to the tuna mixture. A pinch of dried dill weed adds an interesting twist.
                2. The number of sandwiches made will depend on the amount of filling placed on the bread.

descriptionEn: Millet dosa is a vegan & gluten-free south Indian dosa without rice that make a healthy, nutritious & diabetic friendly breakfast.
descriptionFr: Le millet dosa est un dosa du sud de l'Inde végétalien et sans gluten sans riz qui constitue un petit-déjeuner sain, nutritif et adapté aux diabétiques.
tips: Keep batter for fermentation in a container that has enough room to raise. Add little water while grinding. Adjust water depending on required batter consistency. Dosa batter should be of pouring consistency. Make sure it's neither too thick nor too watery. Millets must be soaked for a minimum of 6 hrs to make the grains more digestible.
